div.p: G98/5190, unit 1000, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to inform you that I received to day from the Melbourne Public Library several packages of books, addressed to the late Baron Von Mueller, which had been sent to the Library more than a year ago by the Smithsonian Institution of Washington, which acts as forwarding agent for many scientific establishments. Most of the books are from the United States Geological Survey Department and other American institutions, some from Germany. I would respectfully solicit that you will inform me whether I am to incorporate them in the Herbarium Library
Marginal annotation by Topp on 23 July 1898: 'Yes certainly'. Luehmann returned the file on 26 July with the minute: 'I have put the Govt. Stamp on the books referred to'. — I am of opinion that they have been sent to the Victorian Government — or whether I should take other steps.
